item.title: Assassin's Creed Origins: Edition Differences
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Assassin’s Creed Origins – Standard Edition Content
  • Assassin’s Creed Origins – Deluxe Edition Content
  • Assassin’s Creed Origins – Gold Edition Content
  • Which Assassin’s Creed Origins Edition Should You Choose?

Assassin’s Creed Origins is the first game in the franchise’s RPG trilogy, and the game takes you on a grand adventure across Ancient Egypt. If you are planning to purchase the game, choosing the right edition for your playstyle may feel overwhelming, especially with the game offering multiple editions.

The game is available in three editions: standard, deluxe, and gold , each offering progressively richer amounts of content that’s reflected in their price. Here’s everything you need to know about what each edition of the game offers, and which one might suit your preference and time.

Assassin’s Creed Origins – Standard Edition Content

The standard edition for Assassin’s Creed Origins contains the core game, offering over 40 hours of main story campaign . Stepping in the shoes of Bayek of Siwa, you can explore a massive recreation of Ancient Egypt, its numerous secrets, and experience Bayek’s emotional journey as he overcomes his personal struggles to establish the brotherhood.

If you’re only interested in experiencing a rich main story and sink another 30+ hours into open-world exploration and side content, then the standard edition is all you need to have a great time.

Assassin’s Creed Origins – Deluxe Edition Content

The deluxe edition is a step up from the standard edition, but it mostly offers gear, cosmetics, and character level boosters. Here’s everything you get when purchasing the deluxe edition of AC Origins :

  • Base game.
  • Desert Cobra outfit
  • 2 legendary weapons
  • 1 legendary shield
  • 1 mount skin
  • 3 Ability Points
  • The Ambush at Sea mission

If you’d like a strong start to your journey with better starting gear and a higher character level, the deluxe edition is a great choice. However, the increased price won't get you additional story content if extending your time with the game is on the cards.

Assassin’s Creed Origins – Gold Edition Content

The gold edition of Assassin’s Creed Origins is packed with tons of content, offering a rich narrative experience and environments to explore. In addition to the grand Ancient Egypt, the gold edition also features two exciting locations as part of the two expansions. Here’s everything you get when purchasing the gold edition of Assassin's Creed Origins :

  • Base game
  • Deluxe edition content
  • Season Pass, which includes the following:
    • 500 Helix Credits
    • Horus Pack, which includes a legendary outfit, legendary weapons, and a mount
    • Roman Centurion Pack, which includes a legendary outfit, legendary weapons and a shield, and a mount
    • The Calamity Blade legendary sword
    • The Curse of Pharaoh DLC
    • The Hidden Ones DLC

The gold edition offers the definitive Assassin’s Creed Origins experience, fleshing out Bayek’s story and diving into fantasy and mythology. If you wish to spend hundreds of hours immersing yourself in a vast open world and exploring mythological regions in the DLC, the AC Origins gold edition is what you need.

Which Assassin’s Creed Origins Edition Should You Choose?

Content

Standard Edition

Deluxe Edition

Gold Edition

Base Game

✓

✓

✓

XP Boost

X

✓

✓

Helix Credits

X

X

✓

Desert Cobra Pack

X

✓

✓

Horus Pack

X

X

✓

Roman Centurion Pack

X

X

✓

Exclusive Mission

X

✓

✓

The Calamity Legendary Blade

X

X

✓

The Curse of Pharoah DLC

X

X

✓

The Hidden Ones DLC

X

X

✓

All editions of Assassin’s Creed Origins offer additional free content, all of which was added to the game post-launch, including:

  • Photo Mode: To capture stunning images of breathtaking vistas and share them with the community.
  • Nomad’s Bazaar: Acquire a new daily quest and complete it to achieve a mystery reward.
  • Trials of the Gods: Fight against massive bosses, assuming the forms of popular Egyptian gods.
  • Discovery Tour: Explore and learn about Ancient Egypt in a non-violent setting and as a tourist.
  • Horde Mode: Prove your might against hordes of challenging enemies in the Gladiator arena.

If you’re a casual player who wishes to immerse yourself in the stunning vistas of Ancient Egypt and experience the main story, then the standard edition is a solid choice. On the other hand, if you want some extra flair and a solid start to the experience, but don’t wish to invest additional hours in the game beyond the main story, the deluxe edition will have you covered. The gold edition is for those looking to immerse themselves in Assassin's Creed Origins for 60-100 hours, exploring everything the game has to offer.

item.title: After Elden Ring: Nightreign, FromSoftware’s Next Step Feels Obvious
item.description:
The newly announced spin-off game Elden Ring: Nightreign will mark a new chapter for FromSoftware’s Soulsborne games finally embracing a dedicated multiplayer experience. With Elden Ring: Nightreign ’s focus on co-op multiplayer, the obvious next step for From Software would be a purely PvP-focused game.

As primarily single-player games, FromSoftware’s Soulsborne games inevitably face decreasing player counts as players finish the game and move on, which unfortunately affects the PvP community surrounding each game. Therefore, a standalone PvP Soulsborne game could be the key to uniting the community on a timeless platform. Especially after Elden Ring: Nightreign appears to blend iconic features from past Soulsborne games into a modern co-op experience, PvP multiplayer arguably deserves the same treatment.

Elden Ring: Nightreign Paves a Path for More Multiplayer Soulsborne Games

While multiplayer is a large part of FromSoftware’s Soulsborne games, the core of these games is a purely single-player experience. Naturally, this is part of what makes FromSoftware’s new spin-off game Elden Ring: Nightreign so special, as it essentially flips the script. Based on what’s been shown off so far, Elden Ring: Nightreign is already shaping up to be the most seamless co-op Soulsborne game to date, presumably inspired by one of Elden Ring ’s most popular community mods that abandons some of the restrictions that are commonplace for multiplayer in Soulsborne games.

Elden Ring: Nightreign is designed for co-op between three players, though it will still support solo play and two-player multiplayer.

This new approach to multiplayer in Elden Ring: Nightreign could potentially signal a shift for the next generation of FromSoftware’s Soulsborne games after Elden Ring to maintain a seamless multiplayer experience. At the very least, it creates a golden opportunity for a PvP-focused Soulsborne game or spin-off to finally become a reality.

The Case For a PvP-Focused Soulsborne Game

A Standalone PvP Soulsborne Game Could Unite the Community With a Timeless Platform

The existing Soulsborne games make for great platforms for PvP, as they have the benefit of in-depth progression systems and a variety of buildcrafting tools that players can carry over into PvP game modes. This results in nearly infinite build variety that generally makes no two duels quite the same. However, the downside to PvP multiplayer in FromSoftware’s games is that the community tends to face decreasing player counts as more and more players defeat their last boss and move on from the game.

It is typical for single-player games to gradually lose their player count, though this occurrence doesn’t make it any less frustrating for the players who remain committed to these games solely to participate in PvP activities. Therefore, a standalone PvP Soulsborne game could serve the purpose of uniting the community on a timeless platform that will outlast the inevitably short lifecycle of a single-player game.

From Software’s PvP Multiplayer Deserves the Elden Ring: Nightreign Treatment

While the existing Soulsborne games have the benefit of unique progression systems and buildcrafting tools, a standalone PvP Soulsborne game could still recreate parts of these features, similar to how Elden Ring: Nightreign blends past Soulsborne games into a new, modern experience. For example, each Soulsborne game could have a specific game made that includes unique features from the respective game, like a mode with Bloodborn e’s dynamic health recovery and trick weapons, or an Elden Ring mode with mounts and Spirit Summons.

There has always seemingly been a void for a standalone PvP Soulsborne experience made by FromSoftware, and the need for such a platform is naturally at an all-time high following the announcement of Elden Ring: Nightreign . Regardless of whether this upcoming co-op spin-off will spark a chain reaction in future mainline games changing their approach to multiplayer, a PvP-focused game still seems like a natural progression for FromSoftware’s Soulsborne titles.

item.title: Dead by Daylight Mobile Shutting Down
item.description:
Summary

  • Dead by Daylight Mobile will shut down on March 20, 2025.
  • The game will be removed from the Google Play Store and the App Store on January 16, 2025.
  • Mobile players who switch over to playing the game on PC, PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X/S, or Nintendo Switch can claim a welcome package filled with rewards.

Dead by Daylight Mobile will be shutting down over the next few months as publisher NetEase Games shifts its direction and focus regarding the asymmetrical multiplayer survival horror game. Current players will still be able to access Dead by Daylight Mobile on their handheld devices until mid-March 2025, after which the game will still be accessible via consoles and PC.

Dead by Daylight first launched as a PC exclusive in June 2016, though it's been ported to multiple other platforms over its eight-and-a-half years in operation. The mobile version of Dead by Daylight became a huge hit when it launched in April 2020, being downloaded more than a million times within its first 48 hours of availability on mobile stores.

However, after nearly five years and the addition of plenty of Dead by Daylight killers and survivors, the mobile game's run is coming to an end. The final date for players to access the mobile version of the survival horror game will be on March 20, 2025, according to a post on the Dead by Daylight Mobile official news page. Those who haven't downloaded the game but want to try it before it's gone, or those who have deleted it and want one last hurrah, should act quickly, as the game will be removed from the App Store and the Google Play Store on January 16, 2025.

When is Dead by Daylight Mobile Ending?

  • January 16, 2025 - Removed from the Google Play Store and the App Store
  • March 20, 2025 - Service ends

While the mobile version is reaching its final days, developer Behaviour Interactive seems to have no plans to discontinue additional content in Dead by Daylight 's PC and console versions. Mobile players who are willing to switch over to playing Dead by Daylight on PC, PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X/S, or Nintendo Switch can claim a welcome package filled with rewards.

The standard welcome gift consists of 500,000 Dead by Daylight Bloodpoints and 2,250 Iridescent Shards. Players can also receive additional Iridescent Shards and Auric Cells depending on how much money they have spent on in-game purchases, capping out at 5,000 Auric Cells and 108,000 Iridescent Shards at $200 or more spent, along with up to two million additional Bloodpoints based on the experience they've accrued. Players wanting to claim these rewards will need to log into the mobile game and their Behaviour Interactive account and select which platform they would like the reward applied to before March 20, 2025. Players already playing Dead by Daylight on mobile and another platform will still be able to claim the welcome package as thanks for their time spent.

item.title: Ubisoft Releases NFT Shooter Starring Rayman
item.description:
Summary

  • Captain Laserhawk: The G.A.M.E. is a new NFT arena shooter by Ubisoft.
  • It's set in the same universe as Captain Laserhawk: A Blood Dragon Remix, Netflix's 2023 animated series based on Far Cry 3: Blood Dragon.
  • Rayman plays a prominent role in both the show and the game.

Captain Laserhawk: The G.A.M.E. is the name of a new Ubisoft NFT shooter featuring Rayman. The unusual title is currently only playable on PC.

Game Rant exclusively reported on the existence of a Captain Laserhawk game in January 2024. At the time, a premature PEGI rating revealed that Ubisoft was working on a laser deathmatch game with microtransactions called Captain Laserhawk Niji Warrior . PEGI pulled the rating from its public database following Game Rant's report and has yet to restore it.

The mysterious title was finally launched nearly a year later, materializing with a slightly altered name: Captain Laserhawk: The G.A.M.E. Behind that straightforward moniker is an arena shooter with a top-down perspective for up to eight players. It's currently only available on PC and can be played via the Ubisoft Connect launcher. The current build of the game, which is labeled as an early access version, is approximately 1.19GB in size. A December 19 version of the game's leaderboard listed fewer than 100 players, Game File reports, suggesting that the NFT shooter hasn't yet generated significant momentum.

Captain Laserhawk: The G.A.M.E. Is Technically a Far Cry Spin-Off

Much like its name suggests, Ubisoft's recently debuted title is based on Netflix's animated series Captain Laserhawk: A Blood Dragon Remix . The six-episode show—set in the same universe as Far Cry 3: Blood Dragon —debuted in October 2023 to largely positive reviews. Like the animated series, Captain Laserhawk: The G.A.M.E. stars Rayman in the role of a commentator. A Blood Dragon Remix depicted a much more unhinged version of Rayman than the one from Ubisoft's popular platformers, though it's unclear how much of his larger-than-life show persona made its way to The G.A.M.E.

Regarding the blockchain integration that Ubisoft put together here, Captain Laserhawk allows players to customize their "Niji Warrior" ID card with a headshot, gender, age, and their favorite pro wrestler. This card is part of the game's blockchain, which makes it unique. It can also be changed through regular play, with the overall idea being to build up its value for the purposes of showing off or potentially selling it.

Ubisoft Released 2 NFT Games in 2024

Captain Laserhawk: The G.A.M.E. marks a continuation of Ubisoft's efforts to experiment with NFT gaming applications. In late October 2024, the company released its first blockchain-powered game in the form of Champions Tactics: Grimoria Chronicles , a turn-based PvP RPG. Prior to that, Ubisoft launched some NFT weapons and armor for Ghost Recon Breakpoint in 2021. Neither of those initiatives generated significant player interest.

Source: Game File

item.title: 8 Best Open-World Games For Fast-Paced Gameplay
item.description:
Summary

  • Sunset Overdrive offers fast-paced movement mechanics inspired by popular skating games, keeping players constantly moving.
  • Far Cry 5 provides rural America-inspired settings with fast-paced action and plenty to explore.
  • Cyberpunk 2077 offers a rich atmosphere with continuous updates, exciting combat, and diverse activities.

Open-world games are amazing thanks to how versatile they can be. Between the immersive sound design, various characters, NPCs, weapons, armor and challenges they offer players, games in this genre are always a blast to play and can keep anyone busy for months.

Some titles in the open-world genre present players with the possibility to pick an evil route for their character, which can impact the outcome. Others focus more on character customization and class systems, which are also very entertaining. What seems to be an ever-present factor in titles like these is thrilling combat and interactions. Here are some of the best open-world games for fast-paced gameplay.

8 Sunset Overdrive

An Exciting Game That's Always In Motion

  • Players must keep moving at all times
  • The game mechanics are reminiscent of skating games from the early 2000s

Sunset Overdrive is one of those games that takes a very original concept and combines it with popular game mechanics that were present in the early 2000s. The game's premise is quite unique, however, the way in which The Player moves and explores the city is reminiscent of the popular skating games that everyone loved back in the day.

Players will have to slide on railings, jump on storefronts and use every element at their disposal to fight off the mutants taking over the city. This makes Sunset Overdrive a game that will keep players on their toes at all times.

7 Far Cry 5

Rural America Always Has Something To Keep Players On Their Toes

  • Set in a region that's inspired by rural America
  • Fast-paced action and lots to discover

The Far Cry franchise is known for setting each one of its games in different locations, usually based on real life places. This is not the exception for Far Cry 5 , which takes place in Hope County, a fictional location that could be based on a region from real life Montana in the United States.

Similar to other Far Cry games, this title will have players sneaking around their enemies and firing weapons, which is nothing new for the franchise, but as they say, if something’s not broken, there’s no reason to fix it.

6 Cyberpunk 2077

Exploring A Dystopian Futuristic City Is Always Thrilling

  • Immersive atmosphere
  • The game is constantly being updated, and new things are frequently added to it

Although Cyberpunk 2077 had a rough start to its life due to various performance bugs, it’s now safe to say that it’s one of the best open-world games with the greatest atmospheres out there. Set in the dystopian Night City, this game always offers players something new to discover. Whether it is interesting NPC interactions, fun side quests, street races, or infiltration missions, players will find that there’s no shortage of activities or challenges.

Even if they've already completed the main story and the DLC, new things are always being added to the game, and thanks to its fast-paced combat mechanics, Cyberpunk 2077 seems to have a long life ahead of it.

5 Ghost Of Tsushima

A Combination Of Peaceful Horseback Rides And Exhilerating Combat

  • Detailed environments that are both peaceful and beautiful
  • When Jin engages in combat, players will have to stay on their toes

Some would argue that Ghost of Tsushima is a peculiar choice for this list, as it has many moments that aren’t fast-paced, but quite the opposite. A good chunk of the game will have players riding on horseback through peaceful fields, admiring the beautiful landscapes that developer Sucker Punch Studios crafted for them.

However, when Jin gets down to business and fights the invading Mongols, things take a quick turn. Ghost of Tsushima ’s combat mechanics are complex and complete, requiring players to learn the ropes quickly and develop catlike reflexes to survive.

4 Elden Ring

It's Critical To Be Always On The Move

  • The more Sites of Grace players discover, the more streamlined gameplay becomes
  • Challenging bosses and an original world full of wonders

Many players agree that Elden Ring is FromSoftware's magnum opus. This title took many of the already popular game mechanics from the Dark Souls franchise and implemented them into a vast open world full of possibilities and dangerous enemies.

At the beginning, players might feel like discovering The Lands Between is a bit tedious given the size of the map. However, when they discover new Sites of Grace and can fast travel throughout various locations, the gameplay experience picks up significantly, delivering fast-paced action through area enemies and mighty bosses at every turn.

3 The Legend Of Zelda: Breath Of The Wild

Hyrule Has Much To Offer Players

  • The Kingdom of Hyrule is vast
  • Not the first open-world of its franchise

The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild is arguably one of the best open-world Nintendo exclusive games to have ever been released. While this title isn't the first to be set in an open world in the Legend of Zelda universe, it does present players with new, daring game mechanics that make it fun, complex, and entertaining to play.

This game presented players with what was probably the largest depiction of the Kingdom of Hyrule up to that point, opening a new world of possibilities for the franchise.

2 Red Dead Redemption 2

The Wild West Forbids Sedentary Lifestyles

  • Exciting shootouts in the final years of the American Wild West
  • Tons of NPC side quests and interactions

By the time Red Dead Redemption 2 was first released, Rockstar Games was already a critically acclaimed developer. However, this title and its massive success helped the studio grow even more and establish itself as one of the greatest in the world.

Even when players are dozens of hours into a game, Red Dead Redemption 2 still has many things to offer, making it one of the best open-world games of all time. While some players have gone as far as calling Red Dead Redemption 2 a walking horse simulator, a wider number of people agree that that’s part of its charm, and that the game almost always feels exciting and fast-paced.

1 Grand Theft Auto 5

Rockstar Games' Most Successful Game To Date

  • Tons of NPC interactions, cars, weapons, and locations
  • Los Santos is vast and takes inspiration from real-life LA

Grand Theft Auto 5 is, without a doubt, Rockstar Games’ most popular title to date. The game has been out for more than 10 years, and it still retains a recurrent player count that's well into the hundreds of thousands every month. Based on various real-life locations in Los Angeles, Los Santos remains one of the most complete and complex maps in open-world gaming.

As players drive through Los Santos, they'll find no shortage of things to do. Whether it is helping a rogue reporter get some compromising pictures of a celebrity, collaborating with an elderly couple of tourists to collect Hollywood memorabilia, or saving a damsel in distress' day by recovering her stolen purse, the fun never stops.
